pylovo
  • Pylovo GUI
  • Javascript API Reference
  • Postcode Editor
  • display_postcode.js
  • View page source

display_postcode.js

createPLZIDDropdown()

fetches all postcode ids for which results already exist in the database and writes them to a dropdown menu in the GUI so that the user can select them without having to know exactly what exists in the db

selectVersionOfPostalCodeNetwork()

onclick function for submit plz button returns all versions of network associated with the passed id and generates the radiobuttons for the version select gui element

chooseVersionOfPlzNetwork()

onclick function for the Choose Version button of the version select gui element

Returns:

nothing. Return statement exists simply to break out of function in case of faulty input

getPostalCodeAreaByID(plz)

if the user wants to look at preexisting networks we initially post the plz again and get the outline of our network area as a geojson file, which we display on the map We then fetch all networks included in that area and display only the lines to avoid performance hits due to too many objects

Arguments:

  • plz (int) – the 5 or 6 digit ID with which a grid is associated

getPostalCodeAreaByShape(btn)

if the user wants to generate networks from a newly selected area shape, we initially return the shape the user has selected and receive a response containing the building shapes contained in the selected area We check res and oth buildings for emptiness and display them on the map We also change the Select Area button to Generate Network button

Arguments:

  • btn (HTML_button_element) –

openAreaPopup()

onclick function for the Generate Network button makes the area version input GUI visible and adds a listener to it that makes sure the form can only be submitted if the inputs are correct

returnSelectedBuildings()

onclick function for the Generate Network button within the area version input GUI at the moment it only returns the new id and gives an error warning, if the selected version already exists for a given ID It also closes the GUI form

displayPreviewNet(kcid, bcid, line_geoJSON)

adds all lines of a network to a new layer and displays it on the map further defines several inner functions to handle click, mouseover and mouseout functionality and attaches them to the layer We only display the lines of all networks for performance reasons, showing buses adds too many nodes.

Arguments:

  • kcid (int) – the k cluster id of a network

  • bcid (int) – the building cluster id of a network

  • line_geoJSON (geoJSON_dict) – a dict containing all the lines of a network

styleWhenMouseOver()

changes color of network in GUI when the mouse hovers above it

styleWhenMouseOut()

changes color of network in GUI back of default once the mouse no longer hovers above it

populateNetList(listName, list)

creates options for each network we have gotten from the backend

Arguments:

  • listName (string) – key for the html select element we want to attach options to

  • list (list) – list containing the objects we want to create select options for

highlightSelectedPreviewLayer(sel)

onclick function for the network select html element makes sure a network selected in the html select element is highlighted on the map by manually triggering a click event for it

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – reference to the network select html element

sendBackSelectedNetworkKcidBcid()

extracts kcid and bcid from the feature properties of the selected element in the netlist and sends it to the backend

highlightBuildingFeature(e)

mouseover function for buildings on the map

Arguments:

  • e (event) – The event that gets triggered on mouseover of an object on the map

resetBuildingHighlight(e)

mouseout function for buildings on the map

Arguments:

  • e (event) – The event that gets triggered on mouseout of an object on the map

zoomToBuildingFeature(e)

onclick function for buildings on the map

Arguments:

  • e (event) – The event that gets triggered on click on an object on the map

displayBuildingEditOptions(e)

aggregate onclick function for buildings on the map in case click events should have multiple effects

Arguments:

  • e (event) – The event that gets triggered on click on an object on the map

onEachFeature(feature, layer)

is called when buildings are displayed on the map and defines different behaviours for each object on the map

Arguments:

  • feature (dict) –

  • layer (leaflet_layer_object) –

createBuildingPopup(feature, layer)

is called for each building when they are placed on the map and attaches a popup to it, containing a button that allows the user to delete that building the popup could contain other information as well

Arguments:

  • feature (dict) –

  • layer (leaflet_layer_object) –
